26.18.text:
JASON SILVA: So you hear
people complain these days

31.04.text:
The robots are
stealing our jobs.

33.59.text:
AI is coming, the
Terminator scenario.

37.07.text:
But I think that ultimately
people don't really

39.53.text: have a reason to be scared.

41.23.text:
Because I think that what
artificial intelligence

44.17.text:
ultimately comes down
to, what outsourcing

46.59.text:
our cognition into the
machines is really all about,

49.81.text:
it's about amplifying the
most powerful phenomenon

52.73.text:
in the universe,
which is intelligence.

55.00.text:
We're finally learning to
reverse-engineer, distill,

61.36.text:
Once we can create
sentience that is not

64.10.text:
bound by the bandwidth of our
physicality, of our biology,

68.37.text:
we will literally be
creating a sentience

76.13.text:
And at this point,
the runaway train

78.43.text:
that literally is speeding
up at an exponential rate,

83.46.text: The human era will have ended.

85.15.text:
We will have become
our creations.

87.65.text:
They will be our children,
but they will really be us.

91.11.text: There is no reason to fear this.
